page.title: 02Features of Poringland Area
page.content: Blackford Hall Farm is situated near 2 main villages,Poringland and Upper Stoke.Blackford Hall has a large moat with an ancient farmhouse with 320 acres of land.<Blackford Hall has all ready been in the Domesday Book before in 1086>. The area is full of small woods or plantations of mixed woodlands.The landscape is dominated by 3 radio masts to the North run by independent radio,another was damaged in an air accident,a 3rd is a radar station.A transmitting station with masts lies to the South. 2 water towers belong to Anglian water,H.Q. Colchester. Poringland and Framingham Earl churches are both medieval,and are prominent landmarks.There are 2 disused quarries,pits which are used for gravel.Several small streams are visable.1 minor road has a Ford.
